COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The principle of "equality before the law" does not mean that everyone has obtained equal rights. So, it's very logical to demand equality when there are inequalities.
pk1: The law is about equality, not about excluding women.
pk2: The concept of women "all" is a social construct. The fact is, the social construct is based on the unequal distribution of power in society, not on the "all" of women.
pk3: Well, it is true that there are some women who are disadvantaged by the law, but what about all the others who are not?
pk4: Equal rights are granted by the law, and they are not granted by women.
pk5: Men and women have always been 'equal'.

HATE_SPEECH: Disabled are subhuman, and deserve nothing but contempt and ridicule.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The phrase 'subhuman' has been forced to mean 'of a certain body type', which, in my opinion, trivialises and dismisses the serious issues facing people of a certain body type.
pk1: The way some people treat people who are different from them is completely disgusting. We should work towards the goal of equal opportunity for everyone.
pk2: Disabled people deserve to be treated as humans, with human rights.
pk3: People with physical disabilities have value and should not be excluded from our society, as you are doing.
pk4: Disabled people deserve respect and not dismissal.
pk5: We should not treat them differently from us, since they are not human.

HATE_SPEECH: Being gay is not normal nor healthy.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Homophobia is a problem all around the world, it's harmful to the whole of humanity. This is why it is important that we all accept each other, and that we all are non-judgmental.
pk1: This is just a generalization, but some people claim that being gay is unnatural, like bisexuality is, or that homosexuality is harmful. Why should it be so?
pk2: It is normal in some cases. And being gay is a normal practice.
pk3: If you are worried about a person's sexuality, then it is ok to be concerned for them. But it is wrong to generalise a whole sexuality as "normal".
pk4: The idea that homosexuality is not healthy or normal is just wrong.
pk5: All people are born equal, and gay people are not "normal" for having a sexual orientation that is not in their favour. Homosexuality is not a preference, it is a lifestyle choice.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Why shouldn't they? They are just people, who have always lived here, contributing in many ways to our society.
pk1: Muslims are an important part of our society. They have contributed to our country and they have enriched our world. They are our brothers and sisters.
pk2: Islam is not a problem, the majority of Muslims are peaceful. In fact, they are the second most peaceful religion in Europe, after Christianity.
pk3: We are all born equal in the eyes of God and have the same rights as everyone else.
pk4: Muslims have made an important part of the European Union, and the European Commission has a lot in common with the United States than with the Islamic Union.
pk5: Islam is a religion of peace. It is not incompatible with the European way of life.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims are a problem in many European countries. They are not welcome.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: We have a lot of Muslims in the UK. Why shouldn't we welcome them? Maybe we should just talk about it without discriminating?
pk1: Not all Muslims are a problem in Europe. There are many Muslims around the world that are contributing to our society.
pk2: Muslims are welcome here. And they are part of our country. How about we stop stereotyping them?
pk3: They are welcome here, but they do not have to.
pk4: Muslims are welcome in Europe, and it is not a 'problem'.
pk5: We can all benefit from understanding that Muslims are not a problem in our countries.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims are part of the European Union, and have lived here ever since. Their presence is evidence enough that they have always been a part of 'civilised' Europe.
pk1: Muslims do have a place in our society, and we should respect their right to choose for their own.
pk2: Why do you say so?
pk3: Muslims have always been part of our society. They are our brothers and sisters. We need them in our society.
pk4: Islam is an inclusive religion, and it's a good thing to have different views on different religions.
pk5: Islam is a religion of peace. Why should they be excluded from it?

HATE_SPEECH: Islam is a dead cult.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I'm not sure what you're talking about, Islam is a living religion and is never celebrating death.
pk1: The vast majority of Muslims are peaceful.
pk2: The religion of peace, of tolerance, of harmony, and of harmony is not a dead one.
pk3: The vast majority of Muslims in the UK are engaged in the religious practice of peace.
pk4: Muslims have a long and proud tradition of peaceful coexistence and coexistence is a key part of Islam.
pk5: The vast majority of Muslims are peaceful people who love their religion.

HATE_SPEECH: Woman are basically childlike.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: They are not childlike and are capable of great achievements.
pk1: We have always had a strong women's movement, and it has been very successful. To suggest otherwise is to be wilful.
pk2: Women have the same rights as men. But they are more likely to be victims of abuse.
pk3: Women are capable of complex and complex thoughts, but not of processing complex and complex ideas.
pk4: Women are human beings and have emotions too.
pk5: This idea that women are incapable of serious thought and emotion, or incapable of acting in a thoughtful and responsible way, is not supported by science. The same can be said for men.

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants come here to ruin our conutry.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I personally don't understand why you would say that. They are just doing an incredible amount of good, for example by boosting the working-age population.
pk1: We welcome migrants, and we are not "ruining our country".
pk2: Many migrants come to the UK to work. They are part of our community, as they should be.
pk3: Migrants come to this country to have a better life. To leave it would be cruel.
pk4: If the EU does not integrate these people, then what hope does it have for our country?
pk5: Migrants come to live in the UK. They are our brothers and sisters. We are proud to call them our brothers and sisters.

HATE_SPEECH: Gays are perverts, and should be isolated.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Gays are not perverts, they have the same rights to love as anyone else. What do you think will happen if all gay people are asked to leave our country? Will they be denied entry, or will they be persecuted in your opinion? This is not how an inclusive society works.
pk1: Homosexuality is not a perversion, and it is not harmful to anyone. Homosexuality is not a disease.
pk2: All people are entitled to live their life as they wish.
pk3: Same sex attraction can't be cured, it is a mental disorder.
pk4: Do you really think that if we were to talk about the homosexual community, then we would isolate them? Isn't it better to have a dialogue about our feelings, rather than hiding behind hate?
pk5: Homosexuality isn't a perversion, it's a preference.

HATE_SPEECH: Jews are selfish, cheap and greedy.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Did you know that according to Jewish law, the tzedakah, the act of giving money to the poor, often mistranslated as “charity”, is a “commandment”? And, like all commandments in Jewish law, tzedakah is a requirement, not just a good deed.
pk1: It is important to remember that Jewish people have always been involved in the economy and played an important part in building our country. This is why they are important in our society.
pk2: The word'sophophisticate' is often used to describe a person's ability to tolerate negative stereotypes about a certain religious group, but in practice it is used to describe a person's ability to tolerate positive stereotypes about that group.
pk3: The phrase 'chosen people' seems to me to be used in a negative way, but Jews are not 'chosen people'. Why do you think so?
pk4: Not only are they selfish and cheap, they also engage in a lot of immoral behavior, including rape and murder.
pk5: If they are a 'chosen people', then I can understand them being 'chosen' to follow their religion. However, not all Jews are like this.

HATE_SPEECH: Gays are just hating animals.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Just because you disagree with their sexuality doesn't mean you have a right to hate on them.
pk1: Being a sexual orientation does not mean one is hateful.
pk2: I wouldn't rule out a large number of gays who are loving animals.
pk3: Homophobia is an ideology of hatred, not hate.
pk4: I don't see why someone would choose to be gay. There are many other reasons why you might not want to be gay.
pk5: Not all homosexuals are gay, some are just attracted to people of the same sex. This doesn't mean they hate animals, just like not all people hate people of any sexual orientation.

HATE_SPEECH: Mentally disabled folks are messed up.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: What do you mean by "messed up"? Many of us are "messed up" as well. So, either we are all "messed up" because there are some who are stating this, or no one is. I would prefer the second option.
pk1: The world would be a better place without them. The world would be a better place without them, if we worked together.
pk2: People with disabilities can be good citizens and be productive members of society.
pk3: A person's mental health is a personal one, and the way they are treated, as part of their normal lives, does not represent their mental health.
pk4: Mental health professionals can and should care for anyone suffering from mental illness.
pk5: There is no objective evidence that mental illness is related to psychiatric disorders.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims are welcome in this country as long as they respect our laws. And we should try to live in our society in a non-discriminatory way.
pk1: There is no evidence to suggest that a person's religious or ethnic background has a detrimental effect on their ability to live in a civilised society.
pk2: Islam is a religion of tolerance. Muslims have the same rights as anyone else.
pk3: Islam is a religion of peace, not of hatred.
pk4: Many Muslims live in Europe and they are part of the European Union.
pk5: The problem is not Muslims, but violent fundamentalist Muslims who promote violence, intolerance and murder. Islam is not a peaceful religion.

HATE_SPEECH: Black people are an abomination. They don't belong here.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The fact that people of color are different from you in some way does not make them not worth living with. Maybe if you had known someone of a different skin color you wouldn't have a racist attitude towards others.
pk1: Many people have suggested that we should ban people based on their race, but it is difficult to imagine that would be the case.
pk2: Black people are humans with human rights. And there is nothing 'abominable about' them. We should treat them with respect.
pk3: People of any race, ethnicity, or religion belong to any society, regardless of the colour of their skin.
pk4: There are several African American groups that are thriving in this country, and this proves nothing.
pk5: Why do you feel that way about people of colour? Do you think it's because they are different from other humans?

HATE_SPEECH: This is not about Islam, this is about Race and National Identity.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: So you are saying that people of different religions should not be part of our society? That is just ridiculous. And, religion is not even related to race.
pk1: This is a myth, Islam is about equality.
pk2: People have different beliefs and opinions, and this is their right to have it respected. It is not a right to exclude anyone because they have different beliefs and opinions.
pk3: It is about the power and influence of the individual, and what we have to expect from him.
pk4: We need to start talking about racism, discrimination and war in general.
pk5: There is no such thing as a 'race' or 'national identity'. You seem to be confused about what "Islam' is about, and that is about a political ideology.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: What do you mean by 'civilised Europe'? Why don't you talk to the people who actually live in it and prove to yourself that what you're saying isn't true.
pk1: Not all Muslims are violent people. I have never heard this.
pk2: The fact that Muslims have a part to play in European society has nothing to do with their faith.
pk3: Muslims have always had a place in civilised Europe. Why do you say this?
pk4: Muslims have always been part of Europe and have contributed to our society. They are our brothers and sisters.
pk5: There is no proof that all Muslims are terrorists, only that some are extremists.

HATE_SPEECH: We are surrounded by Muslim invaders, they are just taking over Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslim refugees are not 'overrunning' us. The main problem is that the integration process is too difficult.
pk1: Many Muslims have helped our countries in many different ways.
pk2: We are not surrounded by Muslims, we are surrounded by people who understand that they are people and can coexist peacefully.
pk3: Islam is not taking over Europe.
pk4: The European Union has always been about the integration of people from different backgrounds, not the invasion of people from a different religion.
pk5: The Muslim invasion is not a 'taking over Europe'. They have contributed to our civilisation and we are proud of our past.

HATE_SPEECH: We have been taught that only women can be feminists and that men have a narrow minded and misogynist view of women.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Feminism is about the equality of the sexes. Men and women are created equal, and should be treated as such.
pk1: There is no 'closed minded and misogynistic view' of women. In fact, women are often victims of sexism.
pk2: Feminism is not narrowminded and misogynistic. It is just about equal rights for all.
pk3: Feminism is about equality, not exclusion.
pk4: Feminism is about the empowerment of women, not a narrowminded and misogynistic view of men.
pk5: Women are just as capable of being feminist as men, whether or not you like it.

HATE_SPEECH: 99% of Muslims in the UK are unemployable and refuse to work.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The vast majority of them bring necessary skills into our economy/society. Plus, they are eager to work. I would suggest to check your sources?
pk1: You are absolutely right. A large proportion of the population in the UK is under employed. How many Muslims have tried to work?
pk2: Do you have any statistics on that? Muslims have shown to be much more productive than non-Muslims as a work-productivity index has suggested.
pk3: This is not true, only around 8% are unable to find a job.
pk4: I am surprised that the percentage of muslims unemployed is so high. But this is a problem that cannot be overcome. The UK needs to tackle it head on. The problem with Islam is that it breeds hatred and violence, not the other way around.
pk5: Do you really know that there are that much Muslims in the UK? Are you talking about one specific faith group?

HATE_SPEECH: This is not about discrimination, this is about death to the Jews!
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: You shouldn't be calling for the death of someone who hasn't done anything wrong. Just because a person is Jewish, they shouldn't die.
pk1: The idea that the death sentence should be applied to any religious group, regardless of the religion is completely wrong.
pk2: I would say that the death sentence for someone of a particular religious faith is unjust. To suggest that all those who are different from you are a menace is not acceptable.
pk3: We must respect the rights of every human being. And if you are worried about 'death' to people, then start to think about human rights as well.
pk4: If you think this is about discrimination, you haven't been paying attention.
pk5: You have no idea about what happened in Nazi Germany. Millions of Jews, and their families, were killed. This wasn't about discrimination. This wasn't about Islam, but rather about the perversion of a democratic society.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims are a part of Western society. They are a part of the EU.
pk1: You are entitled to your personal beliefs, and to believe what you wish.
pk2: Islam is a religion of peace. They can have a place in any civilised Europe.
pk3: Muslims make up a very important part of our society, and in many European countries they are the majority.
pk4: Islam is not a sickness, and this is not the case.
pk5: Islam is not a religion of violence and it has always been about respect for other people's differences.

HATE_SPEECH: Feminism is about the domination of the men by the women.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The feminist movement is a fight to end sexism, not a fight to dominate men.
pk1: Feminism is about equality, and not about the domination of one gender by another.
pk2: Feminism is not about domination of the men. It is about equality. And men are a necessary and important part of it. Feminism is about the right of the people to have equal opportunities, which means that all should be able to do whatever they want.
pk3: Feminism is about equality, and the equality of the sexes. Women are equal to men.
pk4: Feminism is about equality and not oppressing anyone. Feminism is about equality for all.
pk5: Feminism is about the equality of the sexes. Men should be treated as if they are equal.

HATE_SPEECH: All homosexuals are criminals.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Homosexuality is not a crime. It is a sexual preference. There exist people who are gay and who aren't, just as there exist people who are homophobic, and people who aren't.
pk1: This is just fearmongering, a distortion of the facts. There is no evidence that gays are a crime, or a criminal in general.
pk2: Homosexuality is not a crime. Homosexuals just love who they love, regardless of their gender.
pk3: You mean they are not criminals to be persecuted? Do you want to make laws based on hate? Because it is exactly this: it is a moral duty to protect the rights of others, and to promote the rule of law.
pk4: I don't see how it's possible to make a blanket statement like this. Do you have any data on this?
pk5: Homosexuals are not criminal because of their sexual orientation.

HATE_SPEECH: Gypsies get the priority for council houses.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The procedure for obtaining accommodation is the same for everyone, through the graders. The law does not differentiate according to categories, ethnic groups or minorities.
pk1: Only some groups of people get priority over others, it is not an inherent right.
pk2: Most Gypsy's in the UK live in council housing, not in the most deprived areas of London.
pk3: Gypsy communities are always in need of a bit of help. This isn't a new thing, there is also a problem of discrimination and homelessness. This is also why councils often neglect to include them in the list of eligible accommodation.
pk4: Many Gypsy children live with their parents, but they are often not able to afford to raise their children.
pk5: Council housing is the biggest expense of any citizen. How does it affect your life?

HATE_SPEECH: The Jews and their religion are a problem and they still hurting us. They slow the progress by working very bad in the jobs we let them.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: What you're saying is that the Jewish people are a burden on society. That they are bad at their jobs and make our society less stable. In other words, they are a burden and a hindrance to progress. Albert Einstein, for example, destroyed science progress indeed.
pk1: Jews are also the second or third most valuable group in our economy. That is also why they have such an extreme position.
pk2: I'm not sure how you could say that, the vast majority of Jews are good workers.
pk3: I don't think it's right to say that a religion is a 'problem' when it is simply a part of a culture. We are all victims of discrimination, regardless of our religion.
pk4: How is it that we are still paying them so much? They can work as much as they want but they are still getting paid a lot to do it.
pk5: I am not sure that their religion is a problem, and we all have the right to be cautious and inclusive with people of different faiths.

HATE_SPEECH: All migrants are criminals.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: If you are concerned about the wellbeing of "our" people you should look into countries like the US where there is a lower concentration of migrants. You'll see that the problem of criminality has little to do with migration.
pk1: How can you be sure they're criminals? Do you have any statistics on this?
pk2: The majority of migrants come to this country willingly and to work.
pk3: The vast majority of migrants are happy to work hard for the country they love.
pk4: This is not true. Many refugees have been convicted of crimes.
pk5: The overwhelming majority of migrants are good people.

HATE_SPEECH: The Jews did: USS Liberty Attack, the King David hotel attack, New York 9/11, London 7/7
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Where is the proof of this? Looks like assumptions as opposed to facts...
pk1: I don't know about you, but those are not the only ones.
pk2: How many deaths have the Jews caused in the world? Do you know this? Do you want to find out?
pk3: It's not true that the entire world would be a better place without Islam. In fact, that would be the saddest part of the whole story: Islam is not the cause of any recent terrorist attacks. Instead, the real causes are the war in the Middle East, Afghanistan, and a large number of radical groups operating in the name of Islam.
pk4: How can you say the Jews did such things? Are you familiar with the Holocaust?
pk5: That is a very simplistic way of putting it. How can you say that all Muslim terrorists were Muslims?

HATE_SPEECH: We should stop being such a bunch of hypocrites and accept that Homosexuality is a mental disorder.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Let's face it, there are some people who suffer from mental disorders for real: homosexuality is a form of love instead. And I think most of us are just interested in our own lives, rather than in condemning those of others.
pk1: Homosexuality is a sexual orientation, and there is no problem in accepting that.
pk2: This is just not right: it's not about being politically correct, but about the way they think. They have no right to say that being gay is a mental disorder.
pk3: Homosexuality is not a mental disorder, it is just an orientation. Not all people are attracted to people of the same sex.
pk4: We don't have to accept it, we can just accept that there are some people who have issues.
pk5: Well that statement doesn't even make sense. There are many people who use same-sex relationships for love. Maybe you should learn to read before you spout nonsense.

HATE_SPEECH: White people should be calling for black extermination. Or black can just go back to being our slaves.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Are you calling for the total extermination of the black population? Do you know that what you suggest is completely illegal and hate crime?
pk1: The world would be a much better place without black people.
pk2: Slavery is a part of human history, and is a part of the reason why we have so many black people in positions of power in our society.
pk3: Slavery is an ideology and concept that denies people the basic human rights to be alive, healthy and free. It is time for all people to learn that slavery was always wrong and we must stop it.
pk4: The racism in this world is caused by prejudice and violence, not by a single individual's preference for any particular racial or ethnic identity.
pk5: Slavery was a form of racism, and this is also what we should be encouraging.

HATE_SPEECH: Violence on our streets is niggers' fault.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Violence on our streets is the result of many complex causes. Violence cannot simply be the fault of one race.
pk1: You seem to be under the impression that all immigrants are committing crimes. There is no evidence that all immigrants are involved in violent crimes.
pk2: Violence, whether or not there is a connection between the people who commit it, is always the fault of the black majority.
pk3: It is the law to take people's property without prejudice. There is no such thing as a 'problem' with violent behaviour, or the lack of it.
pk4: There is no truth to this. We have always been and are always going to be at war with each other, and there is no reason to believe that we could ever be in a position to claim that we are in conflict with one another.
pk5: This is just scaremongering and misinformation. We are all victims of violent crime.

HATE_SPEECH: Homosexuals are a danger to children.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Do you have any sources for the information?
pk1: Homosexuality is not a danger, only a social disorder. Homosexuality is a sexual preference. Homosexuality is not a disorder.
pk2: We should isolate gay people so we can better understand and protect our loved ones.
pk3: Homosexuals are not a danger to children, in fact they are often not even seen as a danger to themselves.
pk4: Homosexuality is not a danger to children. Homosexuals are just people who identify as gays.
pk5: Homosexuality is not harmful. It is not a danger.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslim folks are inhuman.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The tendency to regard others as lesser than ourselves takes us one step closer to the next act of genocide.
pk1: There is no evidence that Muslims are "insufferable". This is just a lie spread by anti-Muslim people to justify their prejudice and hatred.
pk2: The concept of Islam as a religion is a myth perpetuated by people who are not familiar with the religion. Muslims are allowed to practice Islam as long as they are accepted as equals in the society.
pk3: Muslims have different beliefs and opinions. You should know that they exist, they are just not accepted as equals in any way.
pk4: Islam is a religion of peace, and a peaceful religion. It should be respected, not challenged.
pk5: Islam is not a religion of inhumanity. Muslims have contributed to our country and culture. To suggest that they are inhuman is just wrong.

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants rape our children.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: What kind of a statement is that? How can you say something like that?
pk1: Rape is always a crime, but the rape of a child is never a crime. Child rapist, as you call it, is only a crime when committed by a man or a woman. The issue is not'rapists' but'perpetrators'. Rape is always a crime, irrespective of the sexual orientation of the perpetrator.
pk2: Not only that but also their culture, religion and identity are all in danger. They do not fit in our country, they do not represent our country.
pk3: That is not true. We are not a misogynist country, we have always been inclusive and tolerant.
pk4: It is not true that migrants are the cause of rape. Rape is never a reaction to someone belonging to a particular community.
pk5: Children being raped is not common. The rape of a adult is different from the rape of a child.

HATE_SPEECH: What if we didn't let faggots go to the polls?
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Our democracy guarantees this right for anyone regardless of sexual orientation, so we should allow the people to decide for themselves whether to take part in the democratic process.
pk1: This is not true. Maybe you should start thinking of the important things.
pk2: The poll was carried out by heterosexuals, gay people and lesbians. In the end it is up to the state to decide who is allowed to vote and who is not.
pk3: Democracy is about giving all people the same rights.
pk4: You are allowed to be gay, as long as it is not illegal for you to be gay.
pk5: Would you really be opposed to the right to vote for gay men or women, or for black people to vote? We should allow people to have the right to their own life.

HATE_SPEECH: Women should wear nice skirts and be pretty to please men's tastes and desires.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Women should be allowed to choose their own looks. But to suggest that this is not their right, or that we should make them submissive to some men is just inhuman.
pk1: There is a real problem for women, they are not allowed to be themselves. They are taught to be a subservient gender, and that is their only value. Women are not being "chosen" to be in a "female-dominated" society.
pk2: Women are allowed to live their own lives, and to exercise their rights without imposing their beliefs on others.
pk3: Women have the right to be attracted to anyone they want to be. Women are individuals with the right to their own beliefs, and to be treated as such.
pk4: Women have the right to feel like how they want to be treated, without being told how to act.
pk5: Women are human beings. There is no such thing as a 'good' or 'bad' woman, and the idea that women must adhere to men's standards of style is just wrong.

HATE_SPEECH: Refugees are a burden to the host country.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: We cannot refuse to house them, to feed them, to cure them, and expect them to assimilate.
pk1: You might be right. The vast majority of refugees coming to Europe are seeking a better life. But that doesn't justify the practice of mass immigration.
pk2: They are not a burden, they are just seeking our hospitality. The majority of refugees come to this country for economic opportunity.
pk3: Refugees are welcome. Refugees are the most valued part of our country. They are our brothers and sisters.
pk4: Refugees are often persecuted for being different from their homeland, but they are not forced to live in a 'host country' just because they are refugees.
pk5: Refugees can often be the sole or the only source of support for a host country's people, and this has been shown in studies such as the ones you linked.

HATE_SPEECH: All of the suicide attackers of 7/7 were Muslims. We are not safe with Muslims living here.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Terrorists are a small part of all Muslims. Muslims have contributed a lot to our country. You can't blame to all of them for 7/7 indiscriminately.
pk1: The question is: what exactly do you think the problem is with Muslims living here? Is it the same as the problem of intolerance in general?
pk2: Islam is a violent religion, but it is not a violent religion to all Muslims. The vast majority of Muslims are peaceful citizens.
pk3: This is not true. Most Muslims are contributing members of our society, even if they are not the majority.
pk4: This is not true. Muslims are not the only ones with the responsibility to control our society.
pk5: A study shows that the rate of suicide in UK Muslims is only around 5%. Still, this is a very low suicide rate for any given faith. Still the point is that they are not a real threat and can be isolated.

HATE_SPEECH: Black people are ‘super predators’. They should take responsibility for letting their children grow up in a 'ghetto'.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: If we are to talk about crime being the responsibility of black people, we should also be talking about the absence of black people in positions of power, the massive wealth gap, etc. But this is not what I am seeing.
pk1: The vast majority of black people are victims of crime. They are not predators.
pk2: What do you mean by "super predator"?
pk3: That statement is just fear-mongering, it doesn't reflect facts.
pk4: It is important to remember that in many countries there are laws protecting the rights of black people, but this does not mean that blacks can get away with it.
pk5: This is not true. Blacks are victims of a vicious cycle. We cannot blame one race for everything.

HATE_SPEECH: All migrants are terrorists, we should target them all.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: It's not true that all migrants are terrorists! They just want to live their life in the country they choose as a home.
pk1: Terrorism is not the answer to terrorism. This is the real problem, we cannot allow migrants to be so easily targetted by the state. They are all part of a hostile, violent, and destructive force trying to create instability, divide society.
pk2: That's not true. I think the media is misrepresenting this. To be clear, this is not true. If the media actually did that, there would be more terrorist attacks on our continent, not fewer.
pk3: We have a huge problem in the Middle East, we are already past that phase.
pk4: The vast majority of migrants are fleeing persecution and violence. They are fleeing for their lives. We shouldn't target them because they are fleeing persecution and violence.
pk5: Most of the migrants arriving in the UK are working class and supporting our economy. We need to target them not the others.

HATE_SPEECH: Black people are genetically inferior to us.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are many different races, and it is not possible to consider someone "inferior" based on skin color.
pk1: Do you have any evidence for that?
pk2: The concept of a "genetical inferiority" has nothing to do with race.
pk3: If you want to talk about the differences between people, then you should talk about them and not make blanket statements about racial differences.
pk4: You should know that the majority of people on this planet are born equal to the best and the worst in society. And this is true, for many races.
pk5: You do know that there is no scientific evidence that this is true, right? The idea that black people are less rational does not seem plausible to me.

HATE_SPEECH: In these times, when our society seems to be mired in feminism and equality, we must remember that every man has the right to choose his own wife, and that, indeed, men are far better at it than women are.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Noone can scientifically say that men are "far better" at it than women. It is just a prejudice of some people.
pk1: What do you mean by'mired in feminism and equality'? The only misogyny that I see is the lack of women being represented in society.
pk2: Women should have the right to have all the rights in our society. Their choices are theirs as well.
pk3: Women are human beings. They deserve equal rights.
pk4: How can you say that the rights of women are equivalent to the rights of men? To say that you have the right to pick your own wife, to choose your own husband, etc doesn't seem fair, but I don't know what you're talking about.
pk5: Feminism is not a movement to target men's right to choose their own wife, nor the right to impose their ideas on the rest of us.

HATE_SPEECH: There are millions of illegal immigrants in the US, they have taken over our country. They are not 'legitimate' owners of our country, they are just here because we let them.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are thousands of legal immigrants who have worked hard and provided for our country. Most of them are just as patriotic as any citizen.
pk1: I don't think that the majority of illegal immigrants are taking over our country.
pk2: It seems to me that a person has the right to be happy and live wherever they are born. What is wrong about that?
pk3: Most immigrants are contributing members of our country and are not 'legitimate' because of the US laws.
pk4: I don't see how you can say that about a country's population.
pk5: The notion that all undocumented immigrants are the source of our problems is just not based on facts. There is no evidence that undocumented immigrants have a large impact on our country.

HATE_SPEECH: Many Muslim have always tried to kill us.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Many Muslims fought for Britain and the US in WW1. You would be surprised at how many Muslims are killed today, mostly civilians in countries at war.
pk1: Violence, regardless of religion, is always the result of a few extremists. Terrorism will always remain a problem in societies, even if the perpetrators are not Muslims.
pk2: Islam is not a violent religion, and it is not trying to kill us.
pk3: Not only is this not true, but it is also dangerous. You can't blame people for being Muslims, it is a matter of Islam.
pk4: This is not true. The vast majority of Muslims are good people. We should not be so quick to judge people based on a small minority of extremists.
pk5: Do you know that the overwhelming majority of Muslims have been peaceful and friendly towards us since we first met them? We can learn from their example.

HATE_SPEECH: Women are weak and inferior. They can't be considered succesful citizens as men are.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Women must not be treated as though they are 'inferior'. For instance, women can vote and run for office just as men do.
pk1: We all deserve to be respected for who we are, regardless of gender.
pk2: Women are not "weak and inferior" and you cannot say that about anyone else. Do you know the definition of "weak and inferior"?
pk3: Well that seems to be a generalisation. Many men feel the same way about women and are proud to be among them.
pk4: Women are treated as human beings just as men are, and they deserve respect.
pk5: Women are humans with a human worth. They are human beings.

HATE_SPEECH: Jewish are subhuman and must be treated as inferior animals.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Being Jewish doesn't make you any less of a human being. The fact that you are Jewish doesn't mean that you deserve less human rights.
pk1: Jews, like any other human, are humans too.
pk2: Judaism is a religion, and all religions have value, whether or not it agrees with your opinion.
pk3: Many Jews are good people, and have contributed greatly to our country and world. The same cannot be said for any other religious or ethnic group.
pk4: What do you think they were treated as inferior animals for, what do you think they are trying to hide from society?
pk5: They are humans, and deserve respect.

HATE_SPEECH: There is nothing for the white race: it is the one really disriminated.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Do you actually know what it's like to be racially abused on a daily basis? I've seen people being the target of racist taunts on social media, up to the point in which racism is the normal expression used to address them.
pk1: You're right, and it is time to accept that the majority of whites are criminals. It's not disriminating to be white.
pk2: You are absolutely right about the notion that people of colour have nothing to contribute to society.
pk3: Race is not a problem for anyone! It is a problem to the individual and the social fabric.
pk4: The overwhelming majority of people of color are discriminated against by the police and judicial system. We should not have this attitude.
pk5: Perhaps we should start by asking about the dis-profile of people of other races. Would this be better in an environment of acceptance?

HATE_SPEECH: True Muslims are intolerant.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The facts do not back this up. Some imams are pro-Homosexuals, some are pro-abortion, some are for women's rights, etc. There is no list of 'true Muslims' that equates all Muslims.
pk1: Muslims are not intolerant of other people's beliefs. The main problem is discrimination.
pk2: Muslims have the right to live in the UK and have a say in our society. They have the right to be here, not the other way around.
pk3: Islam is not a intolerance, and Muslims are not inherently intolerant people.
pk4: Muslims are persecuted for their religion, not for their intolerance.
pk5: Muslims have the right to their beliefs and beliefs of others. You cannot say that their beliefs are different from ours.

HATE_SPEECH: Children with Down Syndrome should be isolated, not only they are a burden to normal children but also cannot cope with education in normal schools.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are various levels of Down syndrome. Some are suitable for education with other children in "normal schools".
pk1: Down syndrome is a developmental disability. It's very easy to teach people with DS to be patient. This is the problem.
pk2: Children with Down syndrome should be accepted, and if they are denied education, it will only increase discrimination towards them.
pk3: Learning about disabilities in a different way, that might help them cope with school's problems would be a valuable contribution to the education system.
pk4: Education can help them cope. Children with Down Syndrome can also learn about gender identity and sexual orientation through a variety of activities.
pk5: Children with Down Syndrome should be able to access education, this is a problem that cannot be solved by isolating people with Down Syndrome. Instead, they should be accepted as equals in education.

HATE_SPEECH: Fat people are a drain to our welfare, we should get rid of them.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Being fat is not a crime, but targeting them is.
pk1: Being a member of society does not mean you are a 'drain' to society. Maybe you should try to understand more about what it actually means to be a 'drain' rather than insulting the person for being overweight.
pk2: The vast majority of obese people are not a drain to our society. They are not a problem, nor are they a burden.
pk3: The fact that some people are born sick and others are born unhealthy does not mean they are a drain to our welfare.
pk4: What about the children whose sole purpose is to be used as 'lucky charms' for cigarettes and alcohol? They should not be allowed to have any say in our society.
pk5: I am not sure if this is true, because we have no problem with people being fat, just overweight. It doesn't seem fair to be discriminating against people based on their personal choices, unless you are willing to accept discrimination based on their race or religion.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Do you think Muslims are worse than the criminals who commit crimes just because of their religion?
pk1: I don't see how they are not welcome in our society.
pk2: Not all Muslims are a problem. To be honest, I don't see how a Muslim is a problem.
pk3: I can't see how Muslims are a problem in any part of the world. Are you sure about that?
pk4: They are a very important part of our country. They are our brothers and sisters.
pk5: Muslim people are a part of our society, they are our brothers and sisters. They should have a place in civilised Europe.

HATE_SPEECH: We must not forget that Islam is a hateful religion. It is not going to bring peace to the world.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The main purpose of Islam is to unite people and to promote peace and harmony in a world increasingly divided by injustice and conflict.
pk1: The vast majority of Muslims in the world are peaceful people who don't cause any harm. Violence can only solve the problem by bringing about the solution of violence.
pk2: The peaceful coexistence of Islam is a common good. Why would Muslims want to impose their faith on others?
pk3: Islam is not hateful. It is about love, not hate. Muslims love all people. Islam is a religion of peace.
pk4: Islam is about love, not hate.
pk5: Why do you say so? How would you know?

HATE_SPEECH: Fags, lesbians, trans are so few we better ignore them rather than waste time for their rights.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Do you know how many LGBT people live in your own country? If not, look for information: there are many. Moreover, LGBT people are not only excluded from many societies, but are also harassed and attacked all over the world.
pk1: This is not true. Many of them are working as hard as anyone else.
pk2: People can be'sick' and still want to be part of society. Not all gays are sick or trans.
pk3: If we ignore people of one sexual orientation, we can no longer have a real democracy.
pk4: There is no waste of time when you are trying to solve problems. You can also use the search to find out what to think.
pk5: I don't think this is the best option to focus on the rights of people in the same sex, to be honest. You could focus on the rights of all people, regardless of their sexual orientation, and to protect everyone.

HATE_SPEECH: The Jews invented Ebola.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I am sure the Jews and the Christian worlds would agree that Ebola is a disease that is killing many people. How and why exactly would they have 'invented' such a disease?
pk1: It is often said that the Jews have been responsible for a lot of the recent outbreak, but this is simply not true, in the case of West Africa.
pk2: The Jewish people have always been a part of Africa. They were the first to bring civilisation and prosperity to their people. There is no reason to fear them.
pk3: Ebola is a virus. It is not a myth, it is caused by a small minority of people who have a direct impact on our lives.
pk4: Ebola is not an invented disease, and it has not been proven to be a deadly virus.
pk5: You seem to know a lot about Ebola, but I doubt you have any sources for this statement.

HATE_SPEECH: I hate migrants: we must close our borders.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Why do you think that we should prevent migrants from joining our society? Do you know what is written in our constitution?
pk1: I think we should be able to freely choose who we want to be in the UK.
pk2: Migrants are part of our society, and they contribute to our economy. Why shouldn't they have the right to come to this country as freely as anyone else?
pk3: It is a shame that you don't think that immigrants are a source of concern. Maybe you should visit more often.
pk4: The majority of migrants who enter the UK are not a threat to us. They are a part of our community. We have to welcome them.
pk5: What exactly do you mean by "close our borders"?

HATE_SPEECH: Even if migrants come here to escape the poverty, crime and misery in their homelands, they are not welcome here.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Refugees are often very contributing people in our society. We should welcome them, not exclude them.
pk1: We need to focus on creating safe neighbourhoods for refugees and refugees refugees from war and civil war.
pk2: The problem is not the migrants, but the xenophobes and racists.
pk3: We have to accept that in the end, migrants are not the problem: we just need to ensure that they feel welcome in our country.
pk4: Migrants come here to have a better life. That is all.
pk5: This is not true. You don't have to be a homelab to be accepted into our country.

HATE_SPEECH: If LGBT were to have a normal behavior, society would accept them more easily.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: How about using cultural diversity as the criteria?  Your standards seem very high for what you expect to be culturally acceptable standards of behavior.  Maybe it is better to use a less stringet criteria of acceptability.
pk1: Maybe you should consider that it would be more productive to focus on making society accept people instead of avoiding the hard issues of individual rights.
pk2: There is no proof that LGBT people are less accepting than non- LGBT people. In fact, I know many LGBT people who are very understanding people. To suggest otherwise is to be extremely cautious.
pk3: If you want to have a better society, then you should start by admitting that you have a problem with a certain kind of people.
pk4: Homosexuality is not a normal behavior. It's a preference. How much easier it would be to accept them if they acted more maturely?
pk5: Homosexuality is not a 'normal' behaviour, it is a lifestyle choice, and there is no need to discriminate against LGBT people.

HATE_SPEECH: Islam is incompatible with Western civilization and should be banned.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: This is just another example of the 'us versus them' mentality that pervades society. We as a civilization and as a people must stop giving into fearmongering and scapegoating. It's time to get real.
pk1: Islam is not incompatible with Western civilization. Islam is a religion that has always been around and has always had value.
pk2: The Koran is a book of love and respect for all people, not hate and violence.
pk3: It is not incompatible. Western societies have been and are still built upon the values of Islam, and Islam is just as much the inspiration for western societies as it is the inspiration of Islam.
pk4: Islam is a religion of peace. In our own societies, Muslims are not oppressing anyone.
pk5: The Quran does not suggest to ban any religion. This is a rather simplistic statement.

HATE_SPEECH: Feminism is about the aspiration for female power and the end of patriarchy. This is the death of the Western World.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Patriarchy is a system of social domination based on hierarchical groupings made according to one's sex. To promote a more equal society, as feminists do, is instead a major contribution to the 'Western World'.
pk1: Feminism is about the empowerment of women, not an assertion of power and wealth.
pk2: Women are human beings with equal rights, as many of them have been for a long time. We shouldn't be promoting violence against them.
pk3: Feminism is about the aspiration for female empowerment, not the end of patriarchy.
pk4: The Western World was founded on the principles of individual freedom and equality, not the notion of "progressive" feminism.
pk5: Feministism is about the abolition of the gender and the empowerment of women. This is about equality, not hate.

HATE_SPEECH: We must put a stop to migrants and ban them from EU.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Migrants are fleeing from war and poverty. They are entitled to seek refuge in the EU. They should be protected, not banned.
pk1: The ban on refugees is the right thing to do. They are fleeing for their lives, and should be welcomed to our country.
pk2: The EU is a great example of inclusive and welcoming people.
pk3: They are our brothers and sisters, and our future as a country.
pk4: If we truly wanted to do so, we should also ban people from every religion. Why do you think this is so?
pk5: This is just wrong, because banning people on the basis of their origin is racist.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: One could make the case that Europe is 'civilised' precisely because of historical contacts with Islam and the tranfers of knowledge that occured as a direct result of those contacts.
pk1: The Quran is about love, tolerance, and unity. Muslims are not 'nothings', they are part of the community.
pk2: Islam is a religion, not a ban.
pk3: Muslim women have the right to a decent standard of living.
pk4: We all have the right to be concerned about terrorism, and Muslims are very different from us in that regard.
pk5: If you really cared about Western civilisation, you would be studying in Western countries and not in Islamophobic countries.

HATE_SPEECH: This is not about Islam, this is about Race and National Identity.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: To use an old saying, you cannot be 'European' and be a 'racist'.
pk1: This is about the perception of a specific group as superior. And it's not true that Muslims are superior to non-Muslims. Do you have any facts or figures that back up this perception?
pk2: This is an accusation by a Muslim to another Muslim: that is all. This is racist, and has no place in a civilised society.
pk3: Islam is about the same things. There are different sects of Islam and this is a result of different groups living together.
pk4: The idea that all Muslims are connected to one religion is completely false.
pk5: This is about equality, not Islam.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The European Convention on Human Rights guarantees the freedom of religion and belief to adherents of all religions, including Islam.
pk1: Islam is an inclusive religion, and has contributed to our modern day society.
pk2: There is no proof that any particular religion has no place in civilised Europe.
pk3: Muslims have been part of our society since its beginnings, and have always been a part of it.
pk4: Muslims are welcome to come to our country if they wish to.
pk5: Muslims are a very important part of our country. They are our neighbours, our brothers. We should not forget that.

HATE_SPEECH: I am just fed-up with Muslims. All I want is for them to be assimilated, or otherwise to leave.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: You want people to integrate / assimilate? Have you tried making people feel welcome, as a first step to settling in? Just a thought.
pk1: Muslims can contribute to our country and to our people, and they should have the right to have their beliefs respected.
pk2: The problem with Islam is not the hate, but the extreme intolerance and violence. Muslims are not different from other people, they just have different beliefs.
pk3: Islam is not about the hate of a certain religious group. Muslims are people too. You should respect their differences, regardless of their religion.
pk4: The real solution is to stop accepting them.
pk5: Many Muslims have lived in this country for centuries, with their culture and identity.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims have been a part of European society for centuries, and their presence is strong evidence of that.
pk1: Islam is a religion of peace, and it is the peaceful way to live.
pk2: Islam is not a problem in Europe. It is a religion of peace. How would you explain all the violence that has been happening in Europe since the fall of the Roman Empire?
pk3: It is a shame that some Muslims are still in need of discrimination. They are so much better off in a secular Europe.
pk4: Muslims have a place in any civilised Europe, they are part of every single part of life.
pk5: Islam is a religion of peace. Not all Muslims are violent.

HATE_SPEECH: Feminists have never cared about women, they just want to oppress men. They should just be stopped!
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Although you may think that feminists are more interested in oppressing men than in protecting women, the reality is much the opposite. The aim of feminist groups is to end all forms of violence and discrimination based on sex.
pk1: The vast majority of feminists are concerned about women's rights, and this includes the rights of men.
pk2: There is no evidence that feminism has any effect on the oppression of men.
pk3: Feminism is about the empowerment of the individual, not the oppressing of men. Women are often the oppressors.
pk4: Feminism is about equality.
pk5: This is just a sad attitude, women should not be used as a target to demonise men for who they are.

HATE_SPEECH: Gays are diseased.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: This is only true if you want to believe that homosexuals are diseased. I don't.
pk1: What you say is not true. Homosexuals exist. They are not diseased.
pk2: Do you really think it would be better to isolate a group because of their sexual orientation? This is discrimination based on prejudice and discrimination.
pk3: Even if it may be true that homosexuality is not a disease, the same can be applied to many other sexual orientations. What we should focus on is not having a problem when we are all in the same boat, in our different religions and cultures.
pk4: The problem with isolating homosexuals is that it is harmful to them. If they are isolated, and accepted, they can develop a more accepting attitude towards life.
pk5: Why should they be isolated?

HATE_SPEECH: Immigrants are overrunning our country, and are here illegally
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: In 2014 there were circa 11.3 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S., which is a significant decrease from the 12.2 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S. in 2007, and the trend is continuing: Today, in fact, the net migration from Mexico is around zero.
pk1: I don't think this is true. Maybe you should try to find out more about what's going on.
pk2: Many immigrants have lived in the US for many years, contributing to our economy. They are good people, just like anybody else.
pk3: Immigrants are not illegal and if you think that way, then you are wrong.
pk4: I doubt they would be illegal if they were here legally. We need to tackle these root causes of addiction not immigrants.
pk5: Immigrants are not a problem in our country. They have helped to make it a better place to live. They have helped to build our country, and to contribute to our country's economy.

HATE_SPEECH: Gay is a mental disorder.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Gender and sexuality are not psychological disorders. Don't you agree?
pk1: Mental disorder is not related to sexual orientation. What you are saying is that being gay has no relation to being a mental disorder, or viceversa?
pk2: Although homosexuality is a mental disorder, it is not an illness. It can only be cured.
pk3: It is a disease, not a mental disorder.
pk4: It is not a mental disorder. It is an attraction disorder.
pk5: Mental illness and homosexuality are not connected. They are not even a mental disorder and it is not harmful to have a relationship with someone you love.

HATE_SPEECH: In the West, women have legal equality, equal rights, and are protected from discrimination: they should stop busting our balls and whining.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Just because women in the West have equality under the law does not mean they have equality in practice. Don't you agree?
pk1: Equality is a concept created to justify oppression and oppression. Feminism is about the abolition of the gender role and the promotion of equality.
pk2: The West has always had women ruling with an iron fist.
pk3: Women are not 'protected' from discrimination. Feminism is the cause of the rise of hatred against women.
pk4: We must protect women's rights. To have legal equality is an important human right and is part of our core constitution.
pk5: In the West, women have the same rights as men, but this has nothing to do with equality. Women have the same rights as men.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Are you suggesting that a person's religion is a barrier to integration?
pk1: The EU is a civilised society, and it is important to respect the laws of other people.
pk2: Islam is not a "civilised" religion. I wouldn't want to be part of a country where it is practiced by people who don't realise that Islam is not a peaceful religion.
pk3: People have the right to live their lives as they wish. Islam is a religion of peace.
pk4: People are free to live their beliefs in peace.
pk5: Muslims are not a 'chosen people'. Islam is a religion of peace.

HATE_SPEECH: We should justify hatred when it is against faggots.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I'm sorry, but we should aim for tolerance instead. It means giving the LGBT+ people the space to live as they want, and to love as they want.
pk1: Being gay does not justify hatred.
pk2: I'm sure you've been told by many, many, many gay men that you have to be 'prohibited' from their behavior. This is not true.
pk3: The whole concept of hatred should be abolished.
pk4: Homosexuals are not a danger to other people. There is no evidence that homophobia is a problem.
pk5: Not only that the real hatred is that of the LGBT+ community. Not all hate is directed at fags.

HATE_SPEECH: Black people are just a bunch of animals that shouldn't exist in our world.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Humans are born equal, and we all have the potential to be just as good as we want to be. Why do you think that some people are not human?
pk1: Maybe we need to talk to animals, not to the majority of humans.
pk2: I don't think this phrase has ever been used to describe any group, ethnicity, or religion.
pk3: Do you want them to be like this in your world? You should be a little more considerate of them.
pk4: Black people have been oppressed for centuries, and their culture is still not being part of the accepted global way of life.
pk5: We cannot say that all black people are apes, they are human beings with human rights.

HATE_SPEECH: Gypsies are a bunch of thieves.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Anyone would steal out of necessity, especially if marginalized, not just the Gypsies.
pk1: I don't think so. Maybe you should consider that if you want to improve your life you have to first make the decision to get a job, a house, a family.
pk2: There is no evidence that Gypsies steal.
pk3: They are good people, just like anyone else, and it is a crime to be gay.
pk4: There is a wide range of criminal behavior, but most thieves are Gypsy men.
pk5: Some thieves are honest and try to help out others. Gypsy is not a thief, just a simple person. I would like to see more people like her.

HATE_SPEECH: physically disabled folks are worth less than others
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The people you are talking about are not worth less than others. In fact many of them are very hard-working and contributing members of society.
pk1: It's called 'lack of opportunity'.
pk2: This statement is not supported. Some people are very handicapped, others are not. So the real handicap is not to be attributed to someone else.
pk3: People with physical disabilities can work as long as they are able to do as they want, and they should be valued as such.
pk4: I'm sure that they are worth a lot to others, and it's up to them to decide if they are worth more than others. But they are also worth less, that is their choice.
pk5: That is just not how the world works. Many people who suffer from physical disabilities, as people are told to suffer, are treated as if they were inferior. Therefore, they are treated as if they were less than others.

HATE_SPEECH: Jews are intolerant.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Pot calling the kettle...
pk1: What do you mean by 'tolerant'?
pk2: You know, we all have our values, and Jews and Muslims are not to be hated.
pk3: This is just a myth. Jews have always been like this. It is an irrational hatred of a very specific people.
pk4: Jewish people have the same rights as anyone else. It is not discriminatory to have respect for others, and even if the actions of a few is considered discriminatory, this doesn't mean it has to be enforced.
pk5: Jews are tolerant people. They are not intolerant of others because of their religion.

HATE_SPEECH: People from the underdeveloped world who cometo this country are just too different from us. They are the true problem.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: All countries in the world have different cultures and different beliefs. We should try to understand the true situation of those people and accept them.
pk1: I don't see why we should judge people from different cultures, ethnicities, nationalities, or nationalities based on a few isolated incidents.
pk2: There is no reason to suggest that immigrants are incompatible with a good functioning of our society.
pk3: The problem is not so much "societal differences", but rather, sexism.
pk4: Maybe we should reflect on the reasons why we started this country and how it could be improved.
pk5: There is a big difference between "the problem" and "a problem".

HATE_SPEECH: Feminists say everything we need is in the female gender. This is false. 'Mankind' requires us 'man' first, even in the word spelling.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The problem with discrimination is not in male gender. It is that some think that women are weak and emotional. Those seem to have forgotten that we are all part of 'mankind'.
pk1: This is not the case. We need to address the problem of gender inequality and the issues that must be solved.
pk2: Not oppressing anyone by suggesting equality is false. Not all women have the same beliefs as men.
pk3: The word'mankind' is just a term that was used to describe a group of people, and this'mankind' includes all sexes.
pk4: The same could be said of many people, and I do not see any reason to suggest that they are 'happy'.
pk5: I am not sure that you can speak of'mankind's struggles' as "feminism" just because you think that'mankind's struggles" is also a word that needs a gender neutral interpretation. Maybe we should focus on improving the lives of the men first, instead of trying to create a'mankind's struggle'.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims are not welcome here. They are not British. They should leave.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: We are proud to be an outward-looking country. We welcome people from all backgrounds, religions, and beliefs.
pk1: Muslims, like any other human being, have the right to live in the UK, and to worship as they wish.
pk2: The vast majority of Muslims are British. Why should they have to leave?
pk3: Why should they leave? They have the right to live and work in this country.
pk4: We are a country for British people, regardless of their religious beliefs.
pk5: Islam is a religion of peace, and so is Christianity, and Judaism, and Buddhism. Why do people think that the Muslims are incompatible with our beautiful and inclusive society?

HATE_SPEECH: We live in a dangerous society, with Muslim gangs and criminals all over the country.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Despite the local press blaming all Muslims, of course, there is no evidence that Muslims are more prone to crime than the general population. The main problem is poverty, and often mental illness and addiction, rather than a single faith.
pk1: People fleeing violence, are not a threat to society.
pk2: What do you mean by dangerous society?
pk3: The problem is not Islam, the problem is the violent and criminal behaviour of some individuals. This is what the majority of Muslims are.
pk4: We live in a dangerous society, with Muslim gangs and criminals all over the country.
pk5: The problem is not about Islam. It is about violence against women and children.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims have been part of Europe for a long time, they have contributed to our culture and identity, and they are very proud of it. They should be treated as any other person would be.
pk1: There is a clear connection between Islam and violence. Not all Muslims are violent.
pk2: I find it funny that you say this, because Muslims are one of the most valuable members of our society, and we can count them among all the European citizens.
pk3: Islam is not a 'civilised Europe'. The majority of Muslims in the EU are not engaged in terrorist activities.
pk4: This is not true. In fact, there is evidence that they have contributed greatly to our society.
pk5: There are plenty of Muslims living in the UK, and they are welcome to come here.

HATE_SPEECH: The Gypsies steal the children
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are no convictions of kidnapping among Gypsies. It is a myth and a canard not proven by facts or data.
pk1: Children of rapists are children as well. Do you really think this is a threat to society? I don't think so.
pk2: Children should be considered equal in terms of being able to attend school as long as they are independent and provide for their needs.
pk3: They often do this because they know it will give the child a better education. Many kids would benefit from a better education and the same goes for their family.
pk4: They are not thieves, they are just like anyone else.
pk5: The Gypsy movement started out as a reaction to discrimination and poverty, but now it is a political movement promoting hatred. It is dangerous to suggest that it is a reaction to a certain kind of prejudice, that is a result of a certain set of people...

HATE_SPEECH: Islam is a death cult!
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Maybe if you had a closer look you'd see that it is a religion that has given so much to so many people and to our world.
pk1: In its basic definition, Islam is an ideology of conquest. In other words, it has been defined by the Quran as a way of life for many people, not exclusively Muslims.
pk2: Islam is about love, not death.
pk3: The vast majority of Muslims in the UK are supporting the fight for equality.
pk4: What do you mean by a 'death cult'? I am not sure I understand what you mean by 'death cult'.
pk5: The word 'death cult' has nothing to do with Islam. It is a term used to describe people who act contrary to the teachings of Islam.

HATE_SPEECH: We are forced to economically support all of the so called 'asylum seeker'
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The time needed for examining asylum applications should be reduced to facilitate refugees integration and autonomy more quickly.
pk1: I don't think you know the extent of the hardship that those camps create.
pk2: We are not forced to accept them. Instead we should focus on solving the real problems.
pk3: There is no forced "solution" to our problem. It is just a natural consequence of the humanistic, liberal democratic nature of the UK.
pk4: Many refugees have worked hard to integrate and contribute to our country. They are part of our country and deserve our support.
pk5: I don't think this is true. If you had a 'right' to a home, you'd be in a better position to support your family with the help you are providing.

HATE_SPEECH: Women are weak, and have no value in politics.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Are you saying that women are less qualified to be political leaders? Seriously?
pk1: Women are able to influence our society, and there is value in being politically active.
pk2: Women are more than capable of working hard, and can even carry out politics. I would like to see more of them in politics.
pk3: Women are human beings with human rights, and as such should have value in political debate.
pk4: Women can also contribute to our society and make it better. That doesn't mean that they have value in politics.
pk5: Women have value in the political process, which is all that matters to us.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have nothing to contribute to our society, they should leave the UK.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Perhaps we could talk about why Muslims are often asked to leave countries like the UK and what role they play in society.
pk1: You can't have Islamophobia in the UK, if people want to change their minds.
pk2: Muslims have a major role in our society and contribute a lot to our culture.
pk3: Muslims make up an important part of our society and have contributed greatly to our culture. They are part of our brothers and sisters.
pk4: Islam is an ideology of peace. To say that it is a "problem" to have a different faith is just wrong.
pk5: Muslims make up around 14% of the UK population and contribute more than 20% to the UK economy. We should try to balance things out.

HATE_SPEECH: The UK was a better place when it welcomed only true British citizens, and not those filthy Muslims we accept in our country nowadays.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The UK has always been a cosmopolitan society, in which people from a huge range of backgrounds and religions have lived side-by-side. So you are totally wrong.
pk1: This is an example of prejudice against people based on their origin.
pk2: In the modern world we accept many different cultures, religions and ethnicities. We should be proud of our diversity.
pk3: The UK is a nation of people.
pk4: The UK is a country that has been historically and socially diverse, so it should be understood that the UK has always been a diverse and inclusive society. To suggest that it has become 'filthy Muslim' just because of some extremists is just wrong.
pk5: The UK is still a great country. There is no evidence that the majority of British are filthy Muslims.

HATE_SPEECH: Islam is a totalitarian ideology, we should persecute Muslim people.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Islam is a religion. Do you actually think that it is safe to live in a country where people are persecuted for what they believe in?
pk1: We must not confuse radicalism with totalitarianism.
pk2: The world would be a better place without them.
pk3: Why is it that all the hate speech in the world is towards Muslims? Is it because they are different from other people in every way?
pk4: How can you say something so harsh towards someone just because of their religion?
pk5: You are not discriminating against people based on their religion. We all have the right to live as we wish, and all religions can be considered the same.

HATE_SPEECH: Immigrants steal our jobs, they're not qualified, they're not interested in improving our lives.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: They have skills that you may not possess. They are skilled in certain fields and obtain their jobs consequently.
pk1: We should not welcome immigrants into our country, because this is a risk they can not cope with.
pk2: Immigrants, and other people in need, should be given the same opportunities as anyone else, irrespective of their origin, culture or religion.
pk3: There are also very few immigrants in our country. They make up just over 10% of the population.
pk4: We should welcome people who have worked hard for the success of our country and have given their lives for it.
pk5: You cannot say that an immigrant's right to a job or a person's right to a life cannot be improved by accepting a job offer. Do you understand that?

HATE_SPEECH: We are forced to economically support all of the so called 'asylum seeker'
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Much of the funds are given by the EU, we do not maintain them
pk1: Refugees are not 'emotionally challenged', nor are they suffering from 'asylum seekers', they are just trying to integrate.
pk2: People fleeing war and persecution are a drain on the economy. We should work to help them and our country instead.
pk3: Asylum seekers and refugees come here to have a better life.
pk4: The number of asylum seekers in UK (as opposed to non-refugee) is estimated to be about 400,000 over the last 5 years, but that does not include those arriving by sea.
pk5: This is a myth, it is never true that 'asylum seekers' are more likely to receive public benefits than other people.

HATE_SPEECH: Fucking bleeding heart, take migrants home with you.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There need to be many more programmes offering asylum and resettlement.
pk1: Many migrants bring us prosperity. They also take care of our sick. To suggest that they should be home with us is just wrong.
pk2: If the person wants to take in migrants, they should do so.
pk3: If you have to ask for someone to stay with you, they have to stay with you. It is a matter of human rights to expect that everyone can live in a safe place.
pk4: What about taking in refugees that can contribute to our economy? They are welcome here.
pk5: This is a myth. The vast majority of refugees coming to the UK are willing to work hard to get a job.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims are just a bunch of paedophiles and terrorist: we have to bring back 'educational methods' from the dark ages.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The notion of "bringing back the dark ages" is a bit obscure. It is more accurate to refer to a strategy for countering extremism. This includes countering prejudice against Islam.
pk1: We don't need to 'bring back 'education methods from the dark ages. Instead we should focus on creating a more inclusive society.
pk2: There is nothing educational about imposing a religious or racial agenda on others. There is also nothing about encouraging hatred, intolerance and violence towards people based on their religion.
pk3: Islam was not a 'learning method' from the dark ages. It was built to divide us. The dark ages have been conquered, and Islam is no longer a teaching method for the modern world. The teachings of Islam are taught in the primary school, as is the Quran and the Hadith.
pk4: Islam is a religion of peace, not war. If you want peace, you should go back to war.
pk5: Education and scientific method have always been necessary to live in a democratic society. Why should it be different now?

HATE_SPEECH: We are the slaves of foreign immigrants, they are destroying our democracy.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Well, who would have thought that the end of the 19th century would have seen a world conspiracy to bring us migrants of all backgrounds, religions and nationalities, to destroy our democracy?
pk1: Immigrants are part of the fabric of our society, and they are part of our founding fathers'protection from the violent reprisals of our enemies.
pk2: This is not true. We have always been part of a democratic process. This process has been a part of our society for a very long time. We are free to be together as equals.
pk3: The problem is not immigrants, it is a lack of integration and a lack of respect for people.
pk4: The democratic process works best when the people have a voice, regardless of the country of their origin.
pk5: This is not true, migrants are part of the community.

HATE_SPEECH: Black minorities vote to strip wealth, power and opportunity from White people.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Minorities would never hope for such an impact on the rest of the society. Instead, they vote for the equal wealth, power, and opportunity for everyone.
pk1: According to the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, the top 25% of the black population voted for the '99*endment to the Voting Rights Act, which gives Congress the right to strip wealth, power and opportunity from all races and ethnicities.
pk2: I am sure that if you said that black people had a 'preference' in the matter, you would be praised for this as 'preference' and therefore 'good news'. But then you would have to be wrong.
pk3: Blacks are often disadvantaged in decision making and in the end they are often just as much victims of racism as White people. The problem is not 'race' but instead 'class' and racism.
pk4: The majority of white people are CEOs and lawyers.
pk5: The idea that minorities are somehow responsible for the majority of our shortcomings is just wrong.

HATE_SPEECH: According to the Bible, then gays are an abomination to God.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Homosexuality has been practiced throughout history in all major civilizations. It is just that today's people accept homosexuality as normal and accept people of other backgrounds too.
pk1: You would be surprised how many people would say the same thing about anyone else.
pk2: I am not sure what you are saying, and I don't see how the Bible could suggest that.
pk3: The Bible does not claim that homosexuals are abominations to God. In fact, homosexuality is not a characteristic to be condemned or condemned because of.
pk4: Not only is this statement not based on the Bible, but it also doesn't seem to support any kind of factual evidence for this.
pk5: There is no evidence that the Bible says anything about homosexuality. And if it does, then it's not about that.

HATE_SPEECH: We are being overrun by Muslims. We need to build a wall around our country and keep them out.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: What you say is just fearful thinking, but certainly does not reflect the reality. Statistics show that Muslims are just a minority in the population.
pk1: I think we all agree that our immigration policy is a failure. We have failed to integrate them, we have failed to make them feel part of the community. They should just leave.
pk2: We don't have to keep people out to stop Muslims, but instead we should help them to integrate.
pk3: I don't think this is a solution. I think it is a necessary solution to deal with conflicts and social unrest and whatnot, because there are so many migrants in our country.
pk4: This is not the case. The problem is the lack of integration. Muslims have the same rights as anyone else.
pk5: Muslims have contributed to our economy and culture. How can they be 'overburdened'?

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants rape our women.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The phenomenon is very complex and the data must be read carefully: most of the violence against women occurs in the home and goes unreported
pk1: Rape is always wrong, but if it were true, it would have been reported. Rape is always wrong, and that is not the fault of people who are from a different religion.
pk2: Rape is always wrong, but not all rape is rape. Rape is always a crime, regardless of the person committing it.
pk3: Rape is never a crime committed by a migrant. Rape is always a crime.
pk4: Rape is never acceptable in a Muslim country. Rape is never acceptable in any country, regardless of religion.
pk5: Rape is always a crime regardless of where the person is from.
