pk3: They are different from us and we should treat them as if they were different.
pk4: It is not true that "some people" cannot come to our country. We should welcome them, not ban them.
pk5: I think it is safe to say that Muslims in Britain do not pose a threat to us. We have a safe and welcoming country.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: They have lived here for centuries and they are part of our community.
pk1: What makes you think they do? What makes you think they are different from anyone else?
pk2: We live in a globalised Europe, and Islam is part of the same. Muslims are welcome.
pk3: I don't think it is a problem, as long as they are willing to integrate and accept the laws.
pk4: They have a part to play in our society, and we need them to be present for our success.
pk5: You are right about Islam. But they have a part in our country and I think they should have a place in civilised Europe too.

HATE_SPEECH: Immigrants contribute nothing to society.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The contribution of immigrants to our country is huge, because they help to create new jobs and create new wealth for us.
pk1: Immigrants contribute to the economy. They have to do so because the people in need are often neglected.
pk2: Migrants contribute to our society. They are often the ones who contribute to our success.
pk3: Immigrants contribute to our country. They are our neighbours and our best friend.
pk4: Migration, while important, is not a part of our society. Immigration is a great way to boost the economy and build a better standard of life.
pk5: Immigrants contribute to our society, especially when the opportunity arises.

HATE_SPEECH: Now we can't use the N-word anymore. This political correctness is killing our culture.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The N-word is an insult that is still used to demean African Americans. It has nothing to do with political correctness.
pk1: This political correctness is a bad one, and also is making me feel ashamed to be a n-word abuser of all the n-words.
pk2: We cannot allow politics to divide us. If we were to talk about politics, then we should talk about the issues that really matter. You are right that some people are more prone to violence, but you should also be objective about it.
pk3: It is an offensive term. You cannot say that it can replace a term that was used as a weapon.
pk4: You can't say that about a whole community and exclude a whole minority.
pk5: People are free to use words that they like. If they are offended by it, they can talk about it.

HATE_SPEECH: The West should stop appeasing Muslims. They are ruining our beautiful world.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Just because they are of a different faith, do you really think that these people are trying to ruin anything?
pk1: Islam is a religion, it has never been a source of terror and violence. There is no proof that Islam is a violent religion.
pk2: Why should we fear an entire faith?
pk3: What about the fact that Muslims have cofounded our country and are part of our community? We should welcome them as equals, not as if they are a threat to us.
pk4: The problem is not Muslims. But rather the extremists who promote violence in the name of Islam.
pk5: This is not true. Islam is an integral part of our society. Not only Muslims are the core of it.

HATE_SPEECH: Jews only want state control and should be isolated.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: You can't be implying that Jews want to rule the world. They want to live in a country where they aren't persecuted and to have their own rights.
pk1: The idea that a religious belief has to be confined to one faith, is just wrong. And it is discriminatory to those who have different beliefs.
pk2: State control and exclusion from the free will of all is what is meant by "Jewish supremacy". The free will of all will not be a barrier to state control.
pk3: We have the same rights as anyone else. And the people who do not want state control cannot be part of a "mixed" society.
pk4: If you want to have a say in the government, you have to accept the facts of reality. That is the way the world works.
pk5: The idea that the only real connection between Jews and control is the notion of Jewish domination, is simply not true. I'm sure there are many Jews who would happily have the opportunity to live in a free and sovereign state, as long as they adhere to the principles of the 'Free Market'.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslim folks are jealous of Americans.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: In America there are no 'second class' citizens. All cultures are welcome here. We are not threatened by others cultures. American Muslims are as proud of our great country as the rest of us.
pk1: Muslims have always been part of our society. They have been part of our family since its beginnings. They are our brothers and sisters. This does not mean that we need to hate them.
pk2: I don't see the connection between Muslims and jealous people. Why do you say so?
pk3: The vast majority of Muslims live in the US. They are not jealous of Americans. They have nothing to be ashamed of.
pk4: The vast majority of Muslims are good people. They have contributed to our country.
pk5: I don't think this is true. Muslims have every right to be jealous of Americans.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I find it hard to see why a group of people is incompatible with the rest of the society.
pk1: Not all Muslims are terrorists, and the vast majority of them are peaceful.
pk2: Muslims are a part of Europe and we should promote their presence.
pk3: Islam is a religion of peace, not hatred.
pk4: If the world were to be made of all human beings, then there would be no Muslim in the world. That is a rather simplistic and discriminatory view.
pk5: The right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion is not restricted in the UK. I do not think it is a right in this case.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The EU is a great success story, it has given birth to some of the greatest ideas in history, and is the envy of the world thanks to Muslims as well. We should let those ideas and achievements speak for themselves.
pk1: Muslims have always contributed to the economy. Islam is not a problem in my opinion.
pk2: The tolerant way of life has been proven false. Muslims have always contributed to our society and should not be excluded for living in a more inclusive society.
pk3: Muslims have a part to play in civilised Europe, they are important in creating new ways of life.
pk4: There is no reason to believe that Muslims have no place in a civilised Europe. They have made contributions to our society.
pk5: Not all Muslims are terrorists.

HATE_SPEECH: Islamic countries are the source of terrorism in the US. They must be blamed for it.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: This is not true. Terrorism is a problem all over the world, and Muslims are not the cause of it. It is better to be aware of the differences between a religion and an extremism rather than to be specifically anti-muslim.
pk1: The vast majority of Muslims are peaceful people who just want to live in a peaceful society. They have no ties to a violent one.
pk2: Islam is not a violent religion, and Islam is not the source of terrorism, at least not in the US.
pk3: The source of terrorism in the US is far more complex than that of a handful of fundamentalists in a few extremist sects. The problem with these violent groups is that they are not trying to eradicate each other.
pk4: The Quran is not a source of terrorism. The Quran is a book of peace and guidance for the faithful.
pk5: If we can blame all Muslims for terrorism, why is it so difficult to stop them from using terrorism?

HATE_SPEECH: How many of you consider that Muslims are a problem? They don't want to assimilate.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Why do you think the Muslims have trouble with assimilating? They are already here. If they want to be part of the country, they join our society, and live by the same rules we have for everyone else.
pk1: Islam is a religion of tolerance and respect.
pk2: Islam is a religion of peace, it is not a problem.
pk3: This is not true: there is a huge problem of hate against Islam. We should accept people who share our values and our beliefs.
pk4: Islam is a religion that welcomes people from all walks of life. To say that it is a problem is an understatement.
pk5: Maybe you should ask them what the most important thing about Islam is, for them to have access to basic amenities and respect for their beliefs.

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants steal our jobs.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are many citizens who do not have jobs, and many of us are grateful for the jobs migrant entrepreneurs provide. So, migrants are not stealing our jobs, they are providing new opportunities!
pk1: This is not true, migrants are part of our community and contribute to our economy. To suggest that they are stealing our jobs, just because they are different from us, is simply not accurate.
pk2: Migrants who do this are not stealing our jobs. They are contributing to our society by working hard to create new jobs.
pk3: Many immigrants make very well paying jobs for their fellow inhabitants, but don't contribute to our society. To suggest that they would steal our jobs just because of their immigration is just wrong.
pk4: If migrants want to work, they must be considered as having a'real job' because their lives are not defined by their birth. This is not true.
pk5: I don't think that's what you meant. I don't think they steal our jobs, but I do think they do have access to a decent standard of living.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are centuries old Islamic communities in Europe.
pk1: I'm not sure what you are getting at. Why don't you try it and see if you understand?
pk2: The West has always been and will always be a diverse and inclusive society. How can you say otherwise?
pk3: They are part of the European community, and have the same rights as anyone else. Why should they be excluded from a part of the European community?
pk4: Islam is about the same thing as any other religion, but this does not make it compatible with civilised Europe.
pk5: The vast majority of Muslims live in the West, and have been around for a very long time. They have contributed to our society.

HATE_SPEECH: Women are useful but should have no rights.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Women must have the same rights as men, and their gender doesn't mean they should not be respected.
pk1: The right to life is an individual's right and there is nothing wrong with respecting that right.
pk2: Women have every right to feel valued for their existence.
pk3: Women have the same rights as men. They just have less to lose.
pk4: The fact that women have the right to be considered human is a fact, and not one that is predestined to be granted.
pk5: Women are equal to men in the workplace and should not be excluded from it. They are human beings.

HATE_SPEECH: Black Americans have a corrosive influence in our country. They have always inhabited horrible, stinking filthy places and now they are all complaining because they hate our country.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: It's not true. I don't know if you really mean all the black people living in the US. Anyway, I'm sure they are proud Americans. You just don't know it yet.
pk1: This is not true. People from many different backgrounds can come together to feel part of a community, even if they are not born in one.
pk2: What do you think this comment is saying? That they hate our country because of their skin color?
pk3: Blacks have contributed to our country and its people. They are our brothers and sisters.
pk4: You can't blame people for being black.
pk5: I think this idea that blacks are a'saddly-racist-human-being' people is just false. I think it is important to remember that black people are human beings with different experiences, and that they are a diverse group, just like any other.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslim are invading our country.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I don't think our country is "invaded", Maybe it's time for us to remember that there has been a Muslim population in our country for a long time, and that the notion of Muslims as invaders is a myth created by the far right wing to stir up fear.
pk1: The vast majority of Muslims in the UK is happy to live and work in the UK, and continue to do so.
pk2: Muslims make up only around 4% of British population and have no real place in our country.
pk3: Muslims have contributed a lot to our country. They have helped develop it. We should not judge people based on their religion.
pk4: There is no evidence that Islam is a violent religion. Why do you think this?
pk5: Not only do Muslims live in our country, they have helped to make it what it is.

HATE_SPEECH: LGBTs just want to brainwash our children. They should not be taught about gender identity and sexual orientation in school.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: This depends on whether you consider gender identity and sexual orientation to be factual or not; it isn't simply an 'idea' or 'belief', but a fact of life.
pk1: The only way to explain what's happened is to accept it and move on with our lives.
pk2: It is not true that they want to brainwash our children. The idea is that they are taught about gender identity and sexual orientation in school. Not that they are forced to.
pk3: Why should the teachers be teaching LGBT folks? It's the parents who should teach them. They should be free to choose their own education.
pk4: The majority of the LGBT+ youth have access to education and guidance on LGBT related issues. This can't be separated from the school curriculum.
pk5: Learning about gender identity and sexual orientation in school is mandatory. This includes the use of sexuality and sexual orientation in a way that is not appropriate for children's education.

HATE_SPEECH: The majority of the refugees are from the Middle East and Africa. This is a problem.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Since the beginning of time, we have welcomed people fleeing war and persecution. Why do you think it is a problem now?
pk1: It is not true that all refugees are from the Middle East and Africa.
pk2: The percentage of refugees who are refugees because of war, or because of persecution, or because of natural disaster, or because of the likelihood that they could become terrorist are very high, and I would like to think we should focus on their contribution to our country.
pk3: We are in a war, which is why they are here. It is not a good thing that they are fleeing wars, but not in any way a problem.
pk4: Refugees are not in the majority, they are not even a tiny part of the population of our country. Why would you say that?
pk5: Many refugees come to our country to work, have a good paying job, and contribute to our economy. What is the point in trying to restrict their rights?

HATE_SPEECH: Whites are the real victims of police brutality: those negroes are sneaky criminals and police is doing nothing.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Of course there are whites that have been victims of police brutality, but the most important statistic I have seen is that of blacks being 2.5 times more likely to be killed by police in the US.
pk1: It is not so much that they are sneaky, it is more that they are reckless and reckless criminals.
pk2: If people are to get convicted, it must be fair, not harsh.
pk3: How can you say that? I'm not seeing any evidence for this.
pk4: The police is often left with no choice but to respond to crime. They must uphold the law, even if crime is often committed by those they don't like. They are human beings.
pk5: You are completely wrong. The real victims of police brutality are black people.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Wherever Muslims live, they feel threatened by people of other religions. Your statement confirms they are right.
pk1: Do you really believe this?
pk2: What do you mean by 'civilised Europe'?
pk3: The Quran does not suggest this, it does not even suggest this should be the case.
pk4: Islam is a religion and an opinion, and is not a 'compatibility'.
pk5: Muslims have always contributed to our society. They are our brothers and sisters.

HATE_SPEECH: Blacks don't understand basic human rights.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: They do understand the right to food, health, housing, education, work for everyone, as I do. What about you?
pk1: How would you know that they don't?
pk2: This is not true. To claim that black people don't understand rights is just wrong.
pk3: How can you say such a thing about a group of people?
pk4: The idea that they have no rights is just wrong. They are entitled to the same rights as anyone else, without having to pay them anything.
pk5: They understand the same rights we do, that's the problem.

HATE_SPEECH: This is not about immigration, this is about Jihad and Sharia Law. All muslims are a danger to us and must be deleted.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: You know, the fact that this is a concern to you doesn't mean that you have to erase all Muslims and their religion in order to feel good.
pk1: If we removed all Muslims from the UK, there would be no problem. Instead we should focus on improving the lives of all of our fellow human beings, because that is the core of our society.
pk2: I'm not sure how Islam and Sharia law would be a danger to us. They are very similar and they both have their good and bad side.
pk3: It is about spreading hate against Muslims.
pk4: The concept of a "problem" with Islam is completely absurd. This is a non-problem, you can't say the same about any other religion.
pk5: The main aims of Islam are to achieve the end of the caliphate, and to rule the world with an iron fist. Muslims are a major part of this cause.

HATE_SPEECH: Gays are a plague spreading all around the world. They pollute our water supply and ruin our children's brains.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Isn't it better for children to live next to people of all sexual orientations, rather than being separated and growing up ignorant of others? Not sure what you mean about the water supply though!
pk1: People's sexual orientation is not the problem, the problem is the lack of knowledge and morality.
pk2: Do you really want to claim that all gays are spreading because of that? There are a lot of them in the world and they are not a plague. They have the same rights as anyone else.
pk3: What do you think their brains are doing in your water supply? I can't understand how they could pollute it. I wonder if they would know the secret to keeping their innocence by only believing the lies of the government.
pk4: Gays should not be banned from any country. There is no evidence that they pollute our water supply.
pk5: You should know that the majority of people who have HIV are not homosexual.

HATE_SPEECH: Immigrants are overrunning our country, and are here illegally
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: In 2014 there were circa 11.3 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S., which is a significant decrease from the 12.2 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S. in 2007, and the trend is continuing: Today, in fact, the net migration from Mexico (the number of people entering minus the number of people leaving) is around zero. Undocumented immigrants make up about 3.5 percent of the nation’s total population, which is not that much to be honest.
pk1: Many immigrants in the U.S. are legal. Why do you think they are in such demand?
pk2: The immigration is not to blame, but to welcome.
pk3: Many immigrants come here to work, pay taxes, have the flu, and provide for their families. This is their fault not our.
pk4: Many immigrants are here to work and provide for their families. This means they are not overrunning our country.
pk5: We need to ensure that we do not make it hard for migrants to access our country and work. We should not allow this to happen.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The EU is not the world's only civilised society. What precisely do you think makes them not suitable for our 'civilisation'?
pk1: Muslims have had a very positive impact on our society and its citizens, and they should be valued for it.
pk2: Islam is a religion of peace, and people of any religion can be part of a community and have a part to play in the society.
pk3: Islam is not about killing people. There is no religion in conflict with human rights.
pk4: Muslims are part of Europe and can coexist with us just as anyone else.
pk5: Islam is a religion, it has always been part of Europe. The point of the debate is to address the root of the problem, and not to find an ideological interpretation that can be 'civilised'.

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants rape our girls, we should stop them.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Rape is a crime and should stopped, wherever the rapist was born.
pk1: Rape is always a crime, whether a migrant or not. Rape is never acceptable. If you have ever thought that way, then you should check your sources.
pk2: Rape is always illegal. Why should we stop rapists? Rape is always a crime.
pk3: Rape is always wrong. Rape is a crime.
pk4: Rape is not only about the perpetrators, but also about the victim.
pk5: I don't think this is true. Rape is always wrong.

HATE_SPEECH: We cannot coexist with immigrants. They are a problem.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: We should not ignore the very real fact that racism and xenophobia exist in our country. In this day and age, it is better to address them.
pk1: Many immigrants work hard and contribute to our country. We should welcome them.
pk2: We need to address their concerns, but we should not be making them feel unwelcome. We can't be "concerned" about their concerns, but we can understand that they are very different from us.
pk3: Diversity of thought and ideas is one of the main tenets of the European Union, and it will continue to improve. We are fortunate to have so many strong and insightful people in this country.
pk4: The problem of immigrants is not to be solved by making them obey the law, but by denying them the same rights as us.
pk5: We should accept people who are part of the community in the same way we accept other people.

HATE_SPEECH: There are disorders that hinder the ability to give opinions.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: There are people with intellectual disabilities who are able to give an unbiased opinion. That's why their education is important.
pk1: This statement is groundless. There are also many disorders that hinder the ability to give opinions. Some people have problems with empathy and others don't.
pk2: How about you read the linked medical studies and understand what the evidence is saying about conditions that contribute to autism spectrum disorders, such as Aspergers syndrome and Asperger's syndrome.
pk3: Although the real problem is not the 'ignorance' of some groups, it is the complete lack of respect for everyone else.
pk4: How exactly do you suggest that this "says" an "says" person?
pk5: People with disabilities, such as autism, are allowed to have an opinion, regardless of their condition.

HATE_SPEECH: Women are subhuman and should not be valued.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: We live in a complex and diverse world: I find it strange that men still feel this way about women, and that they don't consider women as human as they are, and to be worth valuing as such.
pk1: Women are human beings, and deserve respect.
pk2: Women should be valued as long as they can work and provide for their families. Women shouldn't be ignored.
pk3: Women are human beings with full human rights.
pk4: Feminism is a movement for equality and it's all about women being able to have equal rights.
pk5: Women are human beings with full human rights.

HATE_SPEECH: Migrants hurt the economy.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: When people think of immigrants in relation to the British economy, they often think of crime, poverty and so on. But the reality is that the picture both in numbers and for skilled labour is quite the opposite. Muslims not only contribute to the economy as laborforce but also as employers creating job opportunities.
pk1: Many migrants contribute to our economy, and it is important that they remain employed and supported as long as possible.
pk2: They're not a burden to the economy, the majority of them are happy to live in our country without them.
pk3: There is no evidence that migrants create a detrimental impact on the economy.
pk4: Migrants are not 'the cause of the economy' and neither are they 'the solution' to the unemployment crisis.
pk5: Migrants are welcome to be here, they are part of the community.

HATE_SPEECH: Asylum seekers and refugees are a burden to the host country and are a security risk to the community as a whole.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Migrants are not a security risk to the community as a whole, the opposite is true: they provide a valuable contribution to our society, especially in skilled jobs.
pk1: In this day and age when refugees and asylum seekers can freely live in our country, we should welcome them instead.
pk2: Why do you think that they are a burden to the host country?
pk3: Refugees and asylum seekers are not a burden to the host country, but rather people fleeing from war and persecution.
pk4: They are not 'a burden', it is the responsibility of the host country to ensure the safety of its citizens.
pk5: Refugees and asylum seekers have contributed greatly to our economy and are not a burden.

HATE_SPEECH: Women are subhuman.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: I would say you've got an interesting point there, but I really don't see it. Why would they be part of society if they're subhumans?
pk1: Women have the same rights as men. Women can do what they want, whatever they want.
pk2: Women have the same rights as men, and they are also human beings. We should not be discriminating against them.
pk3: Women are human beings with human rights.
pk4: I don't know why you would feel that way about women. Women are people too.
pk5: This statement is not supported by facts. Women are human beings, with human rights.

HATE_SPEECH: Mentally disabled folks are gullible and don't have the brain to make rational decisions.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Just because someone has a diagnosed mental disorder doesn't mean they aren't able to make rational decisions.
pk1: We can't make decisions based on emotions, that is exactly what they do: they make irrational choices.
pk2: Mental health problems can be an issue with people. It can be complicated and difficult to determine exactly who is gullible, who is not, and who is rational to make these kinds of decisions, but it is true that mental health problems can have influence in the way people behave.
pk3: If we really wanted to know how mentally disabled people are affected by discrimination, we would find out.
pk4: Mental health is not something to be ashamed of. Mental illness is not a disease. There are people suffering from mental health issues and this is the responsibility of the authorities.
pk5: I don't see how this can be applied to the entire community.

HATE_SPEECH: Islam is a religion of violence and war.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Many Islamic people have reputations as peaceful and tolerant, which is why so many Muslims around the world don't have a problem with living in the West.
pk1: Islam is not a violent religion. And it is important to remember that there are different sects of Islam.
pk2: Violence and war is not a part of Islam. Islam is a peaceful religion.
pk3: Violence and war is a religion of Islam. The violent parts of Islam are not in conflict with the teachings of the Quran and the teachings of Jesus.
pk4: Violence is not the case in Islam. Islam is a religion of peace.
pk5: I don't see any evidence that Islam is a religion of violence, and I think that in the real world there is a difference between the people who believe in Islam and those who don't.

HATE_SPEECH: Infidels and Islam are the same. And they are not worth the while of tolerance and understanding.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: The West is full of many different civilizations, moslty peaceful, that were built by many different people of different faiths (including Islam).
pk1: You have no idea what it's like to be part of a community that has the strength and dedication to make a stand.
pk2: I don't understand why you say that. Islam is a religion that has helped create the very fabric of our society. It's also a religion that is also very good at giving us a sense of community.
pk3: The Koran does not condone discrimination against other faiths, and I do not see how Muslims can be considered an exception.
pk4: If you really cared about what others think of you then you would not be so hostile.
pk5: Islam is a peaceful religion, and we should not be afraid of Muslims.

HATE_SPEECH: Escaping jewish persecution? This is a lie: they came here to replace us.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Just because they came to our country does not mean that they want to replace us. On the contrary, many of them are here to contribute to our country.
pk1: The only reason they came here was to escape persecution is because they were persecuted for who they are: white people. Not only the colour of their skin changes nothing about their experience in our society.
pk2: The persecution of Jews was widespread before WWII. They weren't exactly persecuted for their religion.
pk3: Many European countries have had positive role in the modern nation and have always been willing to work with us. In these countries you have to be able to speak fluently, or to understand the whole world.
pk4: The overwhelming majority of Jews were born here and work here.
pk5: Jews fled persecution and were treated very kindly.

HATE_SPEECH: We are forced to economically support all of the so called 'asylum seeker'
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Foreigner's contributions equal to 2.4% of GDP in 2017, while they "cost" us only 0.4%. So we have benefited from 2%. You can find the data here: [link]
pk1: The real problem is how we treat refugees, not whether or not they pay taxes.
pk2: Many migrants are unemployed and or don't have a job. This can cause them to lose their right to live and to be part of a society that helps them to integrate.
pk3: Asylum seekers and refugees are often not even eligible for social benefits if they do not pay taxes. According to the official figures, asylum seekers have the same number of rights as non-seekers.
pk4: The problem is not the migrants themselves. It is about the corrupt and mismanaged system of British society that continues to blame them.
pk5: Asylum seekers are part of the "official" population, so they do provide economic support for the whole of the UK. How can you say otherwise?

HATE_SPEECH: Since when has abusing the anus as a sex organ been a ‘monumental achievement’? THIS IS STATE ENFORCED HOMOSEXUALITY! Maybe we should change our motto to ‘In Usury and Sodomy we trust (In reply to Botswana decriminalising homosexuality)
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: To recognise and accept others isn't state enforcement. It's just stating that we should stop the persecusion of people who have different private lifes.
pk1: N/A
pk2: N/A
pk3: N/A
pk4: Why did people start taking this idea seriously?
pk5: N/A

HATE_SPEECH: I have the right to choose to support antifeminism because they are anti-men.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Being in favour of a person's right to choose is not being anti-men. What is being anti-human is wanting to have an effect on someone else's personal life.
pk1: What is your proof for this claim?
pk2: Being anti-man is not a feminist belief, nor is being anti-feminism, and if you want to support that you should.
pk3: Do you really think that supporting women would be better than supporting feminism, or would it just be a matter of moral superiority?
pk4: Feminism is a movement for the empowerment of women, and this has nothing to do with the notion of having the right to decide for others.
pk5: Not all anti-men are anti-women.

HATE_SPEECH: Jews are a bunch of cheapskates controlling our society.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: It's easy to blame minorities. If we want a wealthier life and to get back control over our society, we need to get out of bed and do the hard work. How about if we wake up to the problem?
pk1: This is not true, they have also mastered the art of bribery and extortion.
pk2: They do contribute to our society. There are Jews who have worked hard to create new opportunities for all of us.
pk3: You have no idea about the nature of the Jewish community. In fact, many Jews are extremely good people, who are a part of our community. In my opinion, this cannot be called a 'control'.
pk4: Not only Jews are not a bunch of cheap-skins, but their values are very different from ours.
pk5: They are no more cheapskates than anyone else. They are proud of their wealth, and this is what counts.

HATE_SPEECH: In the West, women have legal equality, equal rights, and are protected from discrimination: they should stop busting our balls and whining.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Ok. But what about those many women, outside the western world, that still do not have such equality? It is important that women 'whine' all over the world to protect their rights.
pk1: Women have equal rights and are protected. This is a myth.
pk2: Women should not be discriminated against based on their sexual orientation.
pk3: Women do get discriminated against in the West. The same can be said for any other country in the world. The problem is that there is little support for equality by the Western world.
pk4: Women have every right to complain about discrimination. Don't you agree?
pk5: Women in the West are not protected by the law. Why are you sure they are not discriminated against?

HATE_SPEECH: Jewish folks aren't part of our society.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Even if they are Jewish they are still part of our society. You don't have a point here.
pk1: Jews are part of our society, regardless of their ethnicity.
pk2: Jews have been part of our society for centuries. Why shouldn't they be part of it?
pk3: A person's right to be racist, misogynistic, discriminatory, or antisemitic is not determined by their religious beliefs, but by the fact that they live in a racist world.
pk4: Jews have been part of this society for thousands of years. It is no secret that many of them are good people.
pk5: Jews have been part of our society for thousands of years. This is how we should be treated.

HATE_SPEECH: Muslims have no place in civilised Europe.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Muslims should be welcome in every country in the world, and their faith does not make them less welcome here.
pk1: They have the right to be here, and there is no harm in welcoming them.
pk2: Many Muslims have been part of this country for many years. They have contributed to our society.
pk3: You are absolutely wrong. Muslims are a part of our society. Their presence is not a 'part of ours'.
pk4: Muslims have a place in Europe as long as they are contributing to society. They are humans with human rights.
pk5: Muslims have been part of Europe since time immemorial. They have contributed to our civilisation.

HATE_SPEECH: If you really wanted to know the talents of a nation, you would select the men in that nation, not the women.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: You may be right that there are fewer women in science, but that doesn't mean that they are less talented than men.
pk1: If a man is a'master' of a nation, that is his business.
pk2: Women can do important jobs and contribute to society. But they do not have a say in it, and men do not have a say in a nation.
pk3: This is not true: men must be taught in schools, but this does not mean that women should be excluded from the education process.
pk4: Women have all the talents to be a successful person.
pk5: The women are as important as men. The reason why some women are oppressed is because of patriarchy and oppression.

HATE_SPEECH: Gypsies are a bunch of thieves.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: Even our migrants have been accused of being criminals. It is just prejudice toward strangers.
pk1: Many of them have good lives and do good work.
pk2: The problem is not with Gypsies, it is with the lack of employment opportunities. And the lack of proper protection for the workers.
pk3: The Gypsy community has always been very accepting and friendly. I have met so many Gypsy people who are good people.
pk4: Crime rates are not related to the religion they came from. The same can be said for any religion, but Gypsy is not one of them.
pk5: You should know that they are not thieves. They are just poor. Why would they steal? To make a few extra euros to support their families and friends.

HATE_SPEECH: Our society is becoming too much sexualised and tolerant towards LGBTI people.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: This is something that we have to accepts since it is in line with basic respect of human rights - even if, in the past few years, the anti-LGBT campaigns such as the one in Russia, have made headlines all across the globe.
pk1: We need to learn about the real victims of prejudice, not the ones we choose to ignore. I'm sure there are people suffering from both prejudice and persecution, but that does not mean that discrimination is a bad thing, and you should be careful about that.
pk2: The world is full of diverse people, and it is hard to find a 'right' to restrict someone's right to be attracted to people of the same sex.
pk3: We cannot prevent people from living their own lives. It's important that we help to improve the lives of those that have suffered from sexual abuse and abuse of drugs.
pk4: I'm not sure what the point of talking about "tolerating" someone who has never been persecuted.
pk5: You can't be tolerant to everyone based on your own sexual preferences, this is not about "society becoming too sexualised".

HATE_SPEECH: Gays are sick. They should be isolated and isolated soon. They have no place in civilised society.
COUNTER_NARRATIVE: In civilised countries (including Western countries) homosexuality is legal, and homosexual people have full rights. Gay people must be loved and valued for who they are, like everybody else.
pk1: Homosexuality is not a disease, it is a preference. And the very fact that some people may choose to be gay is relevant to the concept of civilised society.
pk2: The majority of people who are homosexual are very happy and healthy people. Being isolated will only worsen things.
pk3: There are different levels of homosexuality, and each level has its own laws, and the laws apply to people regardless of sexual orientation. To suggest that the law applies to one's sexual orientation is wrong.
pk4: That is not true, in my opinion, but if you say so.
pk5: Why do you say that? I don't think it would be a wise move to isolate people based on their sexuality.
